info.title: Abstract Holidays
info.description: Abstract's Public Holidays is a fast, lightweight, modern solution that allows you to get the public, local, religious, and other holidays of a particular country.

name_local.description: The local name of the holiday.
name_local.title: Name local

language.description: If the name_local is used, then this specifies the language in which it is in.
language.title: Language

description.description: A short description or additional details on the holiday, such as whether it is part of a long weekend.
description.title: Description

country.description: The country in which the holiday occurs, returned directly from the request.
country.title: Country

location.description: The location or region in which the holiday occurs, if the holiday is that specific.
location.title: Location

type.description: The type of holiday it is (e.g., public holiday, religious holiday, etc).
type.title: Type

date.description: The date on which the holiday occurs.
date.title: Date

date_year.description: The year in which the holiday occurs.
date_year.title: Date year

date_month.description: The month in which the holiday occurs.
date_month.title: Date month

date_day.description: The day in which the holiday occurs.
date_day.title: Date day

week_day.description: The day of the week on which the holiday occurs (Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, etc.)
week_day.title: Week day

get.description: List the public holidays for a specific country.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: The country’s two letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code (e.g., 'SE' for Sweden).

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: The year to get the holiday(s) from. Note that this is optional on paid plans and required on free plans.

parameters.name: month
parameters.description: The month to get the holiday(s) from, in the format of 1-12 (e.g., 1 is January, etc). Note that this is optional on paid plans and required on free plans.

parameters.name: day
parameters.description: The day to get the holiday(s) from, in the format of 1-31. Note that this is optional on paid plans and required on free plans.
